resources.string:
• Blocks calls from unknown numbers
• Allows only saved contacts
• Runs in the background
• Long press the button for diagnostics

🛡️ COMPLETE SETUP FOR ANDROID 13+

⚡ QUICK METHOD - Set as Default App:
1. Settings → Apps → Default apps → Phone app
2. Select 'SafecallKids'
3. Confirm the change

📞 ALTERNATIVE - Through Phone App:
1. Open system 'Phone' app
2. Menu (⋮) → Settings
3. Look for 'Spam blocking' or 'Caller ID'
4. Enable SafecallKids

🔍 IF NOT FOUND:
1. Settings → Privacy and security
2. Permissions → Phone
3. Enable all for SafecallKids

🛡️ SETUP FOR ANDROID 12

1️⃣ Set as default phone app:
 Settings → Apps → Default apps → Phone

2️⃣ Enable Call Screening:
 Settings → Apps → Special permissions
 → Call screening services

3️⃣ Phone permissions:
 Settings → Privacy → Permissions
 → Phone → SafecallKids → Allow

🛡️ SETUP FOR ANDROID 10-11

1️⃣ Default apps:
 Settings → Apps → Default apps → Phone app

2️⃣ Call Screening:
 Settings → Apps → Special permissions
 → Call information access

3️⃣ Check permissions:
 - Phone: Allowed
 - Contacts: Allowed
 - Display over other apps: Allowed

🛡️ SETUP FOR ANDROID 9 AND EARLIER

✅ Basic permissions are sufficient for this version!

The app will use legacy blocking method:
- Phone permission
- Contacts permission
- Display over other apps permission

Click 'Already configured' to activate.
🔸 SAMSUNG: May be in \'Settings → Applications → Choose default apps\'
🔸 XIAOMI: Go to \'Settings → Apps → Default apps → Phone app\'
🔸 HUAWEI: Look in \'Settings → Apps → Default apps\'
🔸 SAMSUNG: May be in \'Applications\' instead of \'Apps\'
